titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1943-11-13 - WSM

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. The file may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed without permission. End users must obtain all required permissions or consents from the owners of such rights. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: First recording is an excerpt of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 13, 1943. Featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Bashful Brother Oswald (performer), The Duke of Paducah (performer), Rachel Veach (performer) [unconfirmed], and Minnie Pearl (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording is an excerpt of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 6, 1953. Featuring Rex Allen (host, performer), the Old Hickory Singers (performer), Kitty Wells (performer), Neal Burris (performer), Tommy Jackson (performer), Lew Childre (performer) and Stringbean (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Third recording is an excerpt of a Royal Cola sponsored Grand Old Opry segment featuring Roy Acuff (host), Louis Buck (announcer), and Bashful Brother Oswald (performer) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
